job_description:
Must Haves

Five + years experience developing, deploying and support highly available database applications.
Extensive experience with Oracle 19c.
Extensive experience with Oracle queries, stored procedures, tables and queues.
Experience with JSON messages
Nice to have experience with MS SQL server 2012+

Deliverables Include, But Are Not Limited To

The purpose of this procurement is to competitively procure the services of one (1) contingent Senior Software Developer - Back End to provide services for the "Comprehensive Medication Record for Ontarians project” and initiatives related to the Digital Health Drug Repository.

Design and develop database tables
Design and develop stored procedures
Design and develop database queues

Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include:

Learning and understanding the existing database repository and create or modify database objects taking into consideration performance requirements.
Participate in the deployment of database objects as required.

Desired Skills

College/University undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline from a recognized institution or equivalent experience
Knowledge of laboratory information systems (ideally Digital Health Drug Repository (DHDR) application, and other Healthcare Information Systems used throughout the province of Ontario
At least 5 years experience as an Oracle database developer
Extensive experience working with Oracle stored procedures, creation of tables that contain billions of records, indexes and partitions
Experience writing efficient queries to retrieve data from tables with billions of records
Experience integrating web applications with external web access management systems is desired
Experience with Oracle CLOBs and JSON data
Experience working with Oracle queues
Experience developing, deploying and supporting highly available Oracle database critical applications
Knowledge of MS SQL server 2012+
Experience documenting database solutions, including description of tables and stored procedures
Experience developing and deploying database applications in high-availability environments
Extensive experience in troubleshooting and remediation
Ability to design database objects based on system requirements
Ability to participate in the development of solutions
Knowledge of database design, backup and recovery procedures, preparation of technical specifications for installation, testing and performance of database solutions; assess performance and capacity of existing system making recommendations for improving performance and develop technical documentation
Experience planning, migrating, implementing and sustaining large complex database development projects
Conceptual and analytical skills to assess and evaluate system requirements and conduct cost/benefit analyses for new requirements in planning and designing solutions
Experience with systems evaluation to assess conditions, technical performance and capacity of existing systems and determine need and feasibility of expansion, renovation or replacement
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills, verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills and negotiation skills, team work skills
A team player with a track record for meeting deadlines; strong relationship building, facilitation and influencing skills to successfully partner with internal and external stakeholders
Experience operating in highly political environments and across various organizational cultures
Working knowledge of privacy policies and legislative processes - Health Protection and Promotion Act (HPPA), Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA) and Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA) and associated Health Information Custodian (HIC) requirements
Excellent Communication skills both verbal and written, and strong stakeholder engagement skills
Time Management, with the ability to manage tight deadlines and prioritize multiple projects

Skills

Experience and Skill Set Requirements Criteria Criteria Details Criterion Maximum Rating 1. Minimum 5 years' experience as an Oracle database developer. 20 2. Experience working with Oracle stored procedures and in the creation of tables that contain billions of records, indexes and partitions. 20 3. Experience writing efficient queries to access tables with billions of records, including data in CLOBs and using JSON. 15 4. Experience developing with Oracle queues. 15 5. Nice to have experience with MS SQL server 2012+. 10 6. Experience documenting database developments, including the creation of tables and description of stored procedures. 10 7. Experience with Electronic Health record Repositories such as the Digital Health Drug Repository, Ontario Laboratories Information System 5 8. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and strong stakeholder collaboration, facilitation, negotiation, and conflict resolutions skills 5 Total 100%

Must-haves

Minimum 5 years' experience as an Oracle database developer.
Experience working with Oracle stored procedures and in the creation of tables that contain billions of records, indexes and partitions.
Experience developing with Oracle queues.
MS SQL server 2012+.
